description: The US president played up his role in resolving the conflict between Israel and the Islamic Republic. On the ground, explosions were heard in Tehran and Iranian missiles killed at least four people in Beersheba.

Raphaël Glucksmann sets out policy platform for 2027 French presidential election
description: The member of the European Parliament laid out his party's 'vision for France' on Monday in Paris. The project, focused on Europe, the environment and a 'social contract,' aims to revive 'a pro-European and deeply democratic left.'

headline: Oman taxing the richest: 'It will be interesting to see if Muscat starts a trend'
description: By introducing a 5% income tax on the wealthiest Omanis starting in 2028, the sultanate becomes the first Gulf country to implement such a measure. It is a way to anticipate a decline in oil revenues as global crude prices continue to trend downward, writes Le Monde columnist Isabelle Chaperon.

headline: A century of MI5 secrets are being revealed in the UK's National Archives
description: A unique exhibition traces the history of the legendary British domestic intelligence agency and features a wealth of original documents in a bid to maintain public trust and to counter conspiracy theories.

headline: 'They come in vans and arrest mothers': Fear of immigration raids grips Chicago
description: In Chicago, another sanctuary city targeted by Donald Trump, residents have been organizing to thwart arrests by federal immigration agents and protect the country's second-largest Mexican community, after Los Angeles.

Venice locals protest Jeff Bezos's three-day wedding extravaganza
description: Residents of La Serenissima have formed a group to oppose the wedding of Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and journalist Lauren Sanchez, who have planned a ceremony set to take place between Thursday and Saturday.

headline: 'A furnace': Life under Paris's zinc roofs during a heatwave
description: On Saturday, the French capital faced a heatwave, with temperatures reaching up to 36°C. The residents of the city's 'chambres de bonne,' small top-floor flats, struggled to cope.

headline: Refusing to become a manager is more common in France than elsewhere
description: According to an international survey by Cegos, a significant share of employees showed little interest in becoming managers, especially in France. The reasons include organizational culture, the image of the managerial role and the emergence of alternative models of professional success.
